New Records: Giancarlo Stanton tied Carlos Beltrán and Nelson Cruz for the most homers in the first 35 career playoff games.
Stanton moved into a tie with Judge and Babe Ruth for fourth in club history for postseason homers.
Key Match Events: The Yankees scored two runs in the ninth inning off All-Star closer Emmanuel Clase to win 8-6.
Giancarlo Stanton hit a three-run homer.
Juan Soto hit a two-run homer in the first inning.
Austin Wells also hit a home run for the Yankees.
Yankees relievers struggled in high-leverage situations but managed to secure the win.
Tommy Kahnle secured the final three outs for the Yankees.
Stanton's 404-foot drive in the sixth inning put the Yankees ahead 6-2.
Jhonkensy Noel flied out to the warning track with a man on in the seventh inning.
The Guardians tied the score in the eighth due to a fielding error by the Yankees.
Pre-Game Insights: Yankees LHP Carlos Rodón makes his second start of the series after a strong Game 1 outing.
Guardians right-hander Tanner Bibee will pitch on three days' rest after being pulled early in Game 2.
Post-Match Reflections: Yankees manager Aaron Boone praised the team's resilience after a tough loss the previous night.
Guardians manager Stephen Vogt expressed confidence in his team's ability to perform under pressure.
Giancarlo Stanton emphasized the importance of continuing to push despite the challenges.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Yankees' Ian Hamilton injured a calf and won't be eligible for the World Series if New York advances.
The game had an attendance of 35,263 and lasted 3 hours and 27 minutes.
